ygData.subject: Re: Hey this sounded interesting..
ygData.msgSnippet: This game is very enjoyable even as a casual player, which is what I have to call myself, Ive been playing since release and Im still a bard of almost 25
ygData.messageBody:
This game is very enjoyable even as a casual player, which is what I have to
call myself, Ive been playing since release and Im still a bard of almost 25
levels, now I do have many more personalities, in their teens, and here is
why...... At this level my bard has to almost all the time be in a group to
advance, without takeing 3 steps back for every one forward........ It is
harder to get in a group and get established in a location if you have
limited time...... Ever tried to get in groups in HK, can take hour or more.
Which is why I have many characters in the mid teens, I can solo them.

Jaezebel Moonsong
Gypsy bard of the 24th song
Spirit of the Moon
Innoruuk
-----Original Message-----
From: Blair, Keith (Keith Blair) <kblair@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, October 04, 1999 10:09 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Hey this sounded interesting..


>From: "Blair, Keith (Keith Blair)" <kblair@...>
>
>> I'm going to have to agree Everquest is a game for
>> people who have lots of time on their hands. It's
>> something the casual player is going to have to
>> either accept or move on.
>
>What is your point? That people that don't spend a
>lot of time in EQ should move on? I know people that
>only play one hour every other day and have a great
>amount of fun.
>
>
